Submodules¶

publishers.admin module¶

Admin configuration for the publishers application. Allows administrative management of Publisher organizations and their members.

class publishers.admin.PublisherAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]¶

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin configuration for the Publisher model.

list_display = ('name',)¶
property media¶

publishers.apps module¶

Application configuration for the publishers application. Sets up the metadata for the component responsible for organizational news entities.

class publishers.apps.PublishersConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]¶

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the publishers app.

name = 'publishers'¶

publishers.models module¶

Models for the publishers application. Defines the Publisher organization model and its relationships with Editors and Journalists.

class publishers.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a news publisher that groups journalists and articles under a single organization.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

article_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

editors¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

journalists¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

newsletter_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
subscription_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

publishers.tests module¶

Tests for the publishers application. Validates organizational logic, such as editor permissions and journalist membership.

publishers.urls module¶

URL routing for the publishers application. Defines paths for listing publishers and managing their internal roles.

publishers.views module¶

Views for the publishers application. Handles organizational workflows including publisher creation and member management.

publishers.views.add_editor(request, publisher_id)[source]¶

Add an editor to a publisher (only existing editors can do this).

publishers.views.create_publisher(request)[source]¶

Allow editors to create a new publisher organization.

publishers.views.join_publisher(request, publisher_id)[source]¶

Allow journalists to join a publisher.

publishers.views.publisher_detail(request, publisher_id)[source]¶

View details of a publisher and manage editors/journalists.

publishers.views.publisher_list(request)[source]¶

List all publishers.

Module contents¶

Initialization for the publishers application package.
